content: Some teams might view Reddick as an off-ball weakside linebacker at 6-foot-1, 237 pounds, while others might think he’s best on the inside. He could even end up as a pass-rushing outside linebacker in a 3–4 scheme or a pure 4–3 defensive end. But whatever the case, teams covet that type of lower-body explosion on the edge as a pass rusher and that kind of speed in coverage. Reddick’s athletic versatility will make him appealing to just about any team come April.
